description: Food Safety Plan (Preventive Controls Requirements) covering the development, implementation, and execution of preventive controls systems. This module addresses team formation, hazard analysis, preventive controls, monitoring procedures, validation, verification, corrective actions, and re-analysis requirements.
scope: This module applies to both domestic (U.S.) and foreign food facilities (outside the U.S.) that are required to register under Section 415 of the Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act and comply with the Current Good Manufacturing Practice, Hazard Analysis, and Risk-Based Preventive Controls for Human Food requirements mandated by the FDA Food Safety Modernization Act (FSMA). Auditees have the option to present combined HACCP and Preventive Control Systems, but auditors must report/score separately.

sections.title: Title & Document Control
sections.contentGuidance: Document identification (number, title, version, dates), approval signatures, distribution list

sections.title: Purpose / Objective
sections.contentGuidance: Why this Food Safety Plan exists, FSMA compliance objectives, what it achieves for preventive controls

sections.title: Scope
sections.contentGuidance: What products/processes covered, facility operations included, FSMA applicability, who is responsible

sections.title: Definitions & Abbreviations
sections.contentGuidance: FSMA/Preventive Controls terminology (PCQI, preventive control, process control, allergen control, sanitation control, supply chain control, etc.), minimum 8-10 terms

sections.title: Food Safety Team & PCQI Qualifications
sections.contentGuidance: Food Safety Plan team leader, Preventive Controls Qualified Individual (PCQI), team members with qualifications, training requirements, specific responsibilities

sections.title: Product Description & Intended Use
sections.contentGuidance: Complete product description for each product or product group, ingredients, processing characteristics, distribution method, intended use, target consumer

sections.title: Process Flow Diagram
sections.contentGuidance: Detailed flow diagram of all process steps, product handling steps, on-site verification statement

sections.title: Hazard Analysis
sections.contentGuidance: Comprehensive hazard analysis for each product/product group, biological, chemical, physical hazards, likelihood of occurrence, severity assessment, preventive controls identification

sections.title: Preventive Controls
sections.contentGuidance: Process preventive controls, allergen preventive controls, sanitation preventive controls, supply chain preventive controls, other preventive controls, reasonably appropriate procedures

sections.title: Parameters, Critical Limits & Targets
sections.contentGuidance: Process preventive control critical limits with validation documentation, allergen/sanitation/supply chain parameters and targets, scientific basis

sections.title: Monitoring Procedures
sections.contentGuidance: What to monitor, how to monitor, frequency of monitoring, who is responsible, monitoring equipment

sections.title: Corrective Actions & Corrections
sections.contentGuidance: Corrective action procedures for out-of-specification situations, loss of control handling, affected product disposition, process control restoration, correction procedures

sections.title: Verification Procedures
sections.contentGuidance: Verification activities and schedules, calibration procedures, record review by PCQI or designate, environmental monitoring, validation studies

sections.title: Validation
sections.contentGuidance: Validation work for process preventive controls, PCQI oversight of validation, scientific basis, validation documentation

sections.title: Record Keeping & Documentation
sections.contentGuidance: Food Safety Plan documentation, preventive control monitoring records, corrective action records, verification records, validation records, retention periods

sections.title: Recall Plan
sections.contentGuidance: Documented recall plan, recall procedures, notification processes, product retrieval, effectiveness checks

sections.title: Re-analysis of Food Safety Plan
sections.contentGuidance: Re-analysis at least once every 3 years, re-analysis when significant changes occur, documentation of re-analysis

sections.title: Training & Implementation
sections.contentGuidance: Preventive control training for all workers, specific training for workers directly involved with preventive controls, training documentation, competency assessment

sections.title: Compliance Crosswalk
sections.contentGuidance: Table mapping Primus Code | Requirement | Document Section | Evidence

sections.title: Revision History & Approval Signatures
sections.contentGuidance: Revision table (version, date, description) and signature lines (PCQI, Food Safety Team Leader, QA Manager, General Manager)
